wine.review: This is truly one of the best Chardonnays coming from Chile these days. Full of straightforward varietal character and flavor, this is an unbeatable value.

wine.name: Falling Star Merlot-Malbec
wine.review: Aromatic with ripe fruit flavors and a taste that is dry with appealing red berry flavors and soft tannins. An easy drinking wine that matches well with lighter meats such as fish and pasta dishes.

wine.name: Los Vascos Cabernet Sauvignon
wine.review: A straightforward Cabernet Sauvignon from the Chilean property of Domaine Lafite Rothschild. It's extremely approachable, with ripe cassis fruit and soft tannins to please anyone's palate.

wine.name: Cousiño Macul Finis Terrae, Maipo
wine.review: Deep and dark, this red blend is complex. Blackberries, violets and cocoa abound in the bouquet with cherries, rosemary and black truffle appearing on the palate. Lengthy, spicy finish with subtle tannins.

wine.name: Weinert Carrascal, Tinto
wine.review: A red blend based on Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Merlot. As with most of Weinert's wines, it is aged in large old casks, rendering a more Old World-style bottling. Carrascal is medium-bodied, full of blackberry and red cherry fruit aromas, and shows a hint of spice on the finish.

wine.name: Cousiño Macul Cabernet Sauvignon "Antiguas", Maipo
wine.review: One of the best values in Cabernet Sauvignon. It has remarkable concentration and style with blackberry and plum fruit characteristics with notes of violets and chocolate. A Chilean First Growth.

wine.name: Cousiño-Macul Cabernet Sauvignon
wine.review: Excellent quality from one of the most consistent wineries in Chile. This is a full-bodied, dark-fruited, earthy red wine with ripe tannins.

wine.name: Santa Rita Cabernet Sauvignon, Reserva
wine.review: Dark fruits, baking spices, and soft tannins make this the perfect wine for cold-weather comfort food. This is ready to drink tonight, and won't disappoint your guests.

wine.name: Weinert, Cavas de Weinert
wine.review: Weinert (pronounced vine-ert) is Argentina's most respected and perhaps most eccentric winery. This unique red blend has luscious dark cherry and herb scents, and true potential to improve with age.

wine.name: Walnut Crest Merlot
wine.review: Just an amazing value. Nice plummy fruit balanced against a light touch of oak. The tannins are ripe and ready.

wine.name: Navarro Correas Cabernet Sauvignon
wine.review: Navarro Correas makes some of the best wines coming out of Argentina. This is an elegant and balanced Cabernet Sauvignon with ripe fruit, fine tannins, and a nice long finish.

wine.name: Grgich Fumé Blanc, Napa
wine.review: This Fumé Blanc sees a little oak in both fermentation and aging, giving this white a creamy, full mouthfeel. Still, it exhibits the quintessential Sauvignon Blanc flavors of lemongrass and grapefruit. A great food wine.

wine.name: Catena, Cabernet Sauvignon
wine.review: Catena, one of Argentina's emerging stars, has produced this deeply hued, full-bodied Cabernet Sauvignon that combines rich, Napa-like fruit with mineral and spice notes. Reminiscent of the red wines of Bordeaux.

wine.name: Catena, Malbec
wine.review: This is serious Malbec: ripe and rich with aromas of blackberries and cherries, it has a finish that lingers on, with black fruits and firm flavors of spice.

wine.name: Ch. Ksara Réserve du Couventa, Bekaa Valley
wine.review: Over the past decade, Ksara has seen the introduction of new grape varieties that have grown into vines the Bekaa valley has blissfully nurtured. Ksara has also seen developments in technique such as vines cultivation on wires and the attentive application of advanced science by French oenologists.

wine.name: Viña Bosconia G.R., Lopez de Heredia
Viña Tondonia Gran Reserva, Lopez de Heredia
wine.review: The color of this wine is telling that it's had a more than a few years of age. The palate though is stunningly lively with ripe berries, blood orange aromas and an amazing backbone of minerals and tannin. Earthy, sanguine and a wine of utter sophistication.

wine.name: Viña Tondonia Gran Reserva, Lopez de Heredia
Viña Tondonia G.R., Lopez de Heredia
wine.review: Many consider this the vintage of the century in Rioja. The Viña Tondonia is a vineyard site on the Ebro River. The grapes receive the warmth of the day and the cooling effects of the river by night, creating grapes with robust flavor and acidity. This is a wine of power, with a satin texture that will caress your palate.

wine.name: Navarro Correas Malbec
wine.review: Navarro Correas, one of Argentina's top estates, sources fine Malbec from its Maipu vineyards in the Andean foothills, south of Mendoza city. Aged in French oak, this perennial Astor favorite is a soft, fruity red with engaging spicy character.

wine.name: Fonseca Vintage Porto
wine.review: The Fonseca port house was founded in the early 1800s. This vintage port is incredibly approachable. The fruit is dark, ripe and full of mullberries. The tannins are surprising accessible today.

wine.name: Zweigelt, Umathum
wine.review: If anybody has been blessed by a string of great vintages, it has been Austria. Add to that, the meticulous nature of the winery and you can bet that you're going to be stunned by the wine. This bottle is complex, dry and flourishes in the glass. Full of dark berries, tannins and a good dose of minerals that will pair nicely with meat-based cuisine.

wine.name: Churchill's Finest Reserve Port
wine.review: There are wonderful raspberry, toffee and chocolate aromas and flavors. It is medium-bodied with a big taste, but a sweet and long finish.

wine.name: Mavrodaphne of Patra Kourtakis
wine.review: Dark red, sweet Mavrodaphne is a Greek dessert specialty from Patras, the main wine region of the Peloponnese. Rich and full-flavored, with spicy blackcurrant and dried-fruit character, it is best served slightly chilled. Great with biscotti.

wine.name: Samos Muscat, Kourtakis
wine.review: Samos, an Aegean island off the coast of Turkey, produces this golden, viscous Muscat. It has a nose of sweet pears, peaches and nuts that continue through the lingering, honeyed finish.

wine.name: Tokaji Aszú 5 Puttonyos, Ch. Pajzos
wine.review: Puttonyos is the measure of sweetness in Tokaji Aszú, Hungary's most famous wine. There are six levels, with #6 representing the sweetest. Made from late-harvested, botrytis-affected grapes, Aszú is a highly concentrated, ageworthy dessert wine.

wine.name: Kouros Red, Nemea
wine.review: Made from the fruity Agioritiko grape variety. Comes from Nemea, Greece.

wine.name: Blauer Zweigelt, Berger
wine.review: A cross between the Blaufränkisch and St.-Laurent grapes, the richly colored Blauer Zweigelt grape was developed in 1922 – by one Dr. Zweigelt. This value-driven Austrian red wine is round and smooth, with lively cherry scents and flavors.

wine.name: Egri Bikaver "Bull's Blood"
wine.review: There's nothing to fear in this bottle of Bull's Blood. Its rustic, sturdy character makes it perfect with anything grilled or (even better) spit-roasted.

wine.name: Alvear Fino Montilla
wine.review: From the small Andalusian town of Montilla comes this delicate and elegant Fino with fresh aromas of yeast and tropical citrus fruits. With its crisp, clean finish, it is an excellent apéritif and an ideal partner for tapas, those delightful Spanish finger foods.

wine.name: Lustau Palo Cortado "Peninsula" Sherry
wine.review: Palo Cortado, the rarest and most unique sherry style, combines dark, grand Oloroso character with the soft palate feel of fine Amontillado. This stellar bottling from Lustau has a rich and spicy nose with intense, exotic flavors and terrific length.

wine.name: Veramonte "Primus"
wine.review: This red is based on Carmenère, a rare old Bordeaux grape that was widely planted there in the 1700s and is currently undergoing a revival in Chile. Rich yet elegant, this full-bodied wine from Franciscan Estates' excellent new Chilean property is a top-notch find, and enough to convert anyone who hasn't yet discovered the glories of Chilean wine.

wine.name: Rivola, Abadia Retuerta
wine.review: From the Sardon del Duero, next door to Ribera, Abadia Retuerta showcases rich, ripe Tempranillo fruit in a full-bodied red wine. Ideal with leg of lamb or beef roasts.

wine.name: Gonzalez-Byass "Tio Pepe" Sherry
wine.review: Textbook Fino, Tio Pepe is the world's best-seller, offering a generous bouquet with attractive yeasty, nutty character. Dry and refreshing, with a marked tang to the finish, served it chilled pre-dinner to whet the appetite.

wine.name: Lustau Moscatel "Emilin" Sherry
wine.review: This is a luscious sherry, deep brown in color with flavors reminiscent of burnt sugar and tea with a long raisiny finish. It is perfect by itself at the end of a meal or paired with a rich creamy blue cheese. Enjoy!

wine.name: Lustau Rare Amontillado "Esquadrilla" Sherry
wine.review: Amontillado is an aged version of the driest Sherry style, Fino. The barrel aging imparts a richness that comes across as just a hint of sweetness. Perfect for those who like dry Sherry, but not too dry.

wine.name: Lustau Light Fino "Jarana" Sherry
wine.review: Fresh, floral, lemony aromas abound in a highly fragrant Fino. With zesty citrus and yeast flavors, this light and dry reserve bottling from the renowned Lustau house offers a refreshingly clean finish.

wine.name: Lustau Light Manzanilla "Papirusa" Sherry
wine.review: From the prestigious Lustau house comes a light, dry and refreshing Manzanilla, full of yeasty, lemony, nutty aromas and that characteristic whiff of the Atlantic. Serve chilled, it's a great apéritif and perfect with shellfish.

wine.name: Lustau Pedro Ximenez "San Emilio" Sherry
wine.review: Rich and full-bodied, this golden brown, viscous Pedro Ximenez offers abundant aromas and flavors of prunes, raisins, figs, roasted nuts and exotic spices. Sweet, smooth and luscious on the palate, it's best sipped or poured over vanilla ice cream.

wine.name: Lustau Rare Cream "Superior" Sherry
wine.review: Dark mahogany-chestnut in color, this outstanding Cream sherry offers intense aromas of walnuts, sweet dried fruits and dark chocolate. Similar flavors evoke rich fruitcake in an extremely well-balanced wine that has a lingering finish.

wine.name: Quinta do Infantado Vintage Port
wine.review: This is from the quirky vintage of the millennium, we dare say. It's fleshy with dark berried fruit, peppercorns, and dark chocolate. This house style is on the more reserved side of the spectrum when it comes to the level of sweetness, with superb balance and a mineral tannic finish.

wine.name: Graham's Six Grapes Port
wine.review: Sweet and fruity, this dark ruby vintage character Port is a robust wine with a thick, viscous texture. Earthy, flowery notes show on the nose and there is plenty of super-ripe, jammy blackberry fruit in the mouth.

wine.name: Fonseca Bin 27 Port
wine.review: Blended from reserve wines selected for their intense fruit character and depth of color, Fonseca Bin No. 27 is perfectly structured. Its rich, full body and luscious blackcurrant and cherry flavors, also evident in the nose, carry into an intense, lingering finish.

wine.name: Churchill's White Port
wine.review: White Port seems like such a contradiction. This is still the very lovely fortified wine that you've learned to love, it's just made in a different fashion and therefore turns a different color. This a great wine with hard cheeses, walnuts and more. Some people enjoy this just slightly chilled.

wine.name: Sandeman's Ruby Port
wine.review: There are clean aromas of red fruits, plums and strawberries. It is full of rich flavors yet very well balanced. Matches perfectly with creamy cheeses and chocolate desserts.

wine.name: Sandeman's Tawny Port
wine.review: With aromas of figs and nuts, there is a wonderful texture and richness on the palate. Easy to drink with a great value.

wine.name: Sandeman's Founders Reserve Port
wine.review: This intense ruby red colored port is brilliant and clean. Rich red fruit aromas with a touch of age create an elegant reflection of powerful flavors. This is well balanced on the palate and it gets much better with age. Enjoy now or later.

wine.name: Quinta do Noval LB Port
wine.review: Top-notch vintage character Port, this is a very good introduction to Quinta Do Noval's stellar line. Rich ruby-purple, it offers a vibrant bouquet and a mouthful of lush black fruit. With slight floral notes, it has an elegant, lingering finish.

wine.name: Justino's Rainwater, Madeira
wine.review: This style of Madeira is named thus because it is said to be soft as rainwater and the "color of straw, glistening after a shower of rain." Medium-dry, it is perfect with pates and cheeses or as an after-dinner sipper.

wine.name: Justino's Fine Rich, Madeira
wine.review: Dark amber color, clean nutty aromas, light complexity. Medium bodied with a clean, enjoyable finish.

wine.name: Quinta do Infantado Ruby Port
wine.review: Elegant and rich, this dark, juicy port has excellent balance of fruit, acid, sugar, and tannin. Not too sweet, not too big, it is all-around easy to drink and enjoy.

wine.name: Quinta do Noval, Nacional, Vintage Port
Blandy's Bual 5 Yr. Madeira
wine.review: Elegant and fragrant, this reserve Bual is a medium-rich Madeira, moderately viscous and smooth textured. With five years in oak, it has concentrated dark chocolate-chestnut flavors. Generally served with dessert, the Portuguese enjoy it with cheese.

wine.name: Casa Lapostolle Merlot "Cuvée Alexandre"
wine.review: This rich and lovely expression of Merlot is produced in Chile. Plummy fruit is wrapped in a velvety-smooth texture that only the best Merlots exhibit. Enjoy this with beef stews and braises.

wine.name: Casa Lapostolle Sauvignon Blanc
wine.review: A crisp, dry Sauvignon Blanc that makes an excellent food wine. Its flavors of pineapple, figs, and grapefruit are accompanied by loads of minerality; even without food you'll soon be reaching for a second glass.

wine.name: Casa Lapostolle Chardonnay Cuvee Alexandre
wine.review: This elegant Chardonnay is delicately perfumed with hints of white flower and yellow fruit, yet on the palate it becomes assertive, with a round, full mouthfeel and a long, lovely finish.

wine.name: Ch. Pajzos Muskotály
wine.review: Muskotály (Muscat) is one of those gorgeous, aromatic varieties that lends itself to sweet wines. This dessert wine is floral with a complex nose of chamomile flowers, dried apricots and sultanas. For balance, look no further, the acidity is palpable and perfect on the finish. Enjoy with a slight chill.

wine.name: Taylor Fladgate 10 Yr. Reserve Tawny Port
wine.review: This delightful port has notes of dried fruit and nuts with lovely aromas of caramel and toffee. It is medium bodied with light sweetness and a mellow texture. Serve chilled at the end of any meal.

wine.name: Taylor Fladgate 20 Yr. Reserve Tawny Port
wine.review: This is similar to Taylor Fladgate's 10 year old port. The differences that come out with 20 years of aging is a much nicer texture and more woody notes. The overall balance is much cleaner with flavors that should be savored for as long as possible.

wine.name: Vouvray Brut, Foreau
wine.review: A dry sparkling chenin blanc with great aromatic complexity, showing floral and fruit notes. Rich and complex in the mouth, with pear, quince, and a deep, earthy minerality.

wine.name: Choya Plum Wine with Fruit
wine.review: This is a sweet wine made from a local variety of Japanese plums. It's best enjoyed very chilled or even on the rocks.

wine.name: Stones Ginger Wine
wine.review: Stone's ginger wine is ideally drunk with a good chill.

wine.name: Takara Plum Wine
wine.review: Drink chilled straight or on the rocks.

wine.name: Peter Vella Chablis Bag In Box
Peter Vella White Grenache Bag In Box
Peter Vella Burgundy Bag In Box
St. Francis Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma
wine.review: From Sonoma County comes this solid, traditionally made Cabernet Sauvignon. Rich and deeply fruited with great structure, this wine is sure to please at your next backyard barbeque. Will continue to improve with up to seven years of ageing.

wine.name: Ken Wright Cellars Pinot Noir, Shea Vineyard
wine.review: Medium in body, intensely perfumed, endlessly complex on the palate, which alternates subtle nuance and assertiveness of flavor.

wine.name: Nalle Zinfandel, Dry Creek Valley
wine.review: Lovely raspberry aromas and dry, earthy aromatics greet the nose, followed by a moderate dose of oak. This medium-bodied Zin shows good acidity and tannins that are supportive yet unobtrusive. It has succulent, intense strawberry fruit on the palate, and a finish that is a touch compressed at the moment. Lingering earth and light toast notes frame the brambly fruit. This is an exceptionally civilized California Zinfandel.

wine.name: Lenz Gewurztraminer, North Fork
wine.review: A perfectly delicious dry white with lively acidity. Notes of rose petals, lychees, nutmeg, and clove abound in this highly aromatic wine from the exuberant Gewürztraminer grape. Made on Long Island by one of the finest producers in New York.

wine.name: Big House White
wine.review: Big House White is a terrific, well-priced food wine made from Malvasia Bianca, Orange Muscat, Riesling, Grenache Blanc, and more! With a fresh, floral nose and lively lemon on the nose and palate, it's crisp, dry, and full of flavor.

wine.name: Silver Oak Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley
wine.review: This Silver Oak bottling is produced from 100% Cabernet Sauvignon sourced from several different vineyard sites. It is an elegant, highly expressive wine that exhibits notes of nutmeg, cassis, black plum, and sandalwood, followed by an extremely long finish of savory ripe fruit. Ever since Silver Oak was founded in the early '70s, the winery has dedicated itself entirely to Cabernet Sauvignon.

wine.name: Beringer White Zinfandel
wine.review: This is drier-styled White Zin that has a refreshing edge along with tons of fruit and a nice sweetness.

wine.name: Pacific Rim Riesling
wine.review: This Riesling was clearly made with assertively spiced food in mind. Lots of soft, tropical fruit flavors lead to a clean, dry finish.

wine.name: J Lohr Riverstone Chardonnay, Monterey
wine.review: Great balance of fruit and oak with the great California toastiness. The price is even better.

wine.name: Benton Lane Pinot Noir, Willamette Valley
wine.review: Pinot Noir is the name of the game at Benton Lane, the Oregon-based winery established by noted Californian producer Steve Girard (Girard). The quality is top-notch as evidenced by the current '05 vintage.

wine.name: Ferrari Carano Chardonnay, Alexander Valley
wine.review: Another delicious blockbuster Chardonnay from Ferrari Carano. This has that classic California style: fruit, butter, and vanilla.

wine.name: Cline Zinfandel, California
wine.review: Fred Cline has restored some of California's oldest vineyards. Even his value-driven baseline bottling is bona fide old-vine Zinfandel. The age of the vines shows in the intense complexity of this excellent full-bodied red.

wine.name: Dolce by Far Niente
wine.review: Liquid gold from California, this intensely flavored, Sauternes-style dessert wine was launched by Far Niente in 1989. A rich, heavenly blend of botrytis Semillon and Sauvignon Blanc, it is aged entirely in new French oak for three years. Divine.

wine.name: Calera Pinot Noir
wine.review: Calera specializes in top-quality Pinot Noir from the Central Coast of California. This is a medium-bodied Pinot with a lovely band of strawberry and raspberry right through the finish.

wine.name: Caymus Conundrum
wine.review: This white blend is a must-try for fans of full-bodied Chardonnay who are looking for something a little different. Flavors of ripe fruit and nuts abound here in an extraordinarily rich texture. It's just one more example of great winemaking from Caymus.

wine.name: Spottswoode Cabernet Sauvignon, Napa
wine.review: This is a polished Cabernet Sauvignon coming from the Napa Valley. With blackberry and vanilla flavors, along with underlying earthiness, this wine will go well with roasts, and even barbecues.

wine.name: Beringer Cabernet Sauvignon, Knights Valley
wine.review: The wine that made Knights Valley famous. This has been even better in recent vintages than when it began, yet it has consistently shown a ripe, soft, appealing style.

wine.name: Beringer Chardonnay, Napa
wine.review: Beringer has set a standard for the California style of Chardonnay. The wonderfully exotic flavors in this wine are a terrific match for food.

wine.name: BV Cabernet Sauvignon, Rutherford, Napa
wine.review: If you're looking for fruit, this is the wine for you. Loads of blackberries and black cherries, with notes of cinnamon and incredible overall ripeness to keep you coming back for more.

wine.name: Dr. Konstantin Frank Dry Riesling, Finger Lakes
wine.review: Riesling does very well in the Finger Lakes, and this bottle is no exception. It boasts a beautiful nose of honey and peaches, followed by pear, lemon, and minerality on the palate. Fruit and acidity are in perfect balance, and the finish is silky smooth.

wine.name: Castle Rock Pinot Noir, Mendocino
wine.review: Bright fruit flavors, a silken texture, and fine tannins make the Castle Rock a pristine example of California Pinot Noir. With its classic nuances of cola and toast, this is a wine meant to compete with the finest offerings of Pinot Noir at this price point. Great with herb-roasted chicken.

wine.name: Castle Rock Napa Valley Merlot
wine.review: A generous wine with ripe, full-bodied fruit, soft tannins, and good length. This has all the velvety texture of a Pomerol: try it if you've been unsure about entering the realm of Merlot lately.

wine.name: Ridge Zinfandel Lytton Springs
wine.review: From winemaker Paul Draper comes a truly iconic Zinfandel. For several decades, the Lytton Springs vineyard in Sonoma County has been the source for these well-balanced, pure, and age-worthy bottlings. While rambunctious in their youth, a few years of cellaring brings out layers of flavors and an elegant quality very rarely found in California Zinfandel.

wine.name: Dashe Cellars Zinfandel, Dry Creek Valley
wine.review: Dry Creek Valley creates the perfect ripening conditions for Zinfandel. The result here is black raspberry fruit, with chocolate and spice leading to a long finish.

wine.name: Sinskey Pinot Noir, Carneros
wine.review: Aromas of wild berries, cranberry and cinnamon spice dominate the nose. Fresh acidity balances the lush and sensuous texture so important to Pinot Noir, leaving your mouth watering for more.

wine.name: Essensia, Quady
wine.review: From the orange Muscat grape, a fortified dessert wine that is so good as to warrant a patent on the name. Beautiful aroma of orange patisserie with enough acidity to nicely balance the sweetness.

wine.name: Elysium, Quady
wine.review: Delicious with dessert or as dessert. This wine will keep for a few weeks refrigerated.

wine.name: Rombauer Zinfandel
wine.review: This is rich and vibrant zin from the makers of one of California's most popular chardonnays, blending fruit from some of California's top regions for the varietal: Amador, Napa, Lake and El Dorado. Juicy aromas and flavors of wild cherries and tangy cranberries spiked with black pepper and allspice keep you intrigued from first sniff to last sip. Ripe, medium-grained tannins round out the finish.

wine.name: Ch. St. Jean Merlot Sonoma
wine.review: Almond essence, dark fruits, and lingering toast on the finish will make this an instant favorite. This is a phenomenal value in top-flight California Merlot.

wine.name: Honig Sauvignon Blanc Napa
wine.review: Full-flavored and fully balanced among melon, papaya, grapefruit, lime zest with vibrant acidity and a nice round feel on the palate.

wine.name: Ridge Zinfandel Paso Robles
wine.review: Paso Robles produces some of the biggest, fullest Zins around, and this is no exception. Bursting with raspberry and boysenberry fruit and with an exceptional, ageworthy structure. We haven't seen Paul Draper's Paso Robles bottling in several vintages, and we're thrilled to have it back!

wine.name: Estancia Chardonnay, Monterey
wine.review: Lots of vanilla with a touch of peach in a soft oaky style.

wine.name: Hogue Cabernet-Merlot Columbia Valley
wine.review: A bit on the lighter side for a Cabernet-based wine, this wine is very soft with aromas of herbs, berries and oak and a surprisingly long fruity finish. A very good red for cocktail parties, poultry or lighter meats.

wine.name: Franciscan Merlot Napa
wine.review: Harvested and crafted with care in Napa Valley's Rutherford area, this is as good an argument for drinking Merlot as any we've encountered. Like a classic Bordeaux, this is perfectly ageworthy, but right now it's showing lovely ripe blackberry and cherry flavors, great balance, and a clean finish.

wine.name: Bogle Petite Sirah
wine.review: Bogle is a consistent source of top-value Petite Sirah. Black pepper and spicy nuances enhance this wine's plum, berry and cherry flavors, with everything nestled in a comfortable bed of oak. Smooth and harmonious.

wine.name: Kendall-Jackson Chardonnay Vintners Reserve
wine.review: Toasted hazelnut aromas lead to a supple mouth feel with flavors of brown butter and honey.

wine.name: Bogle Chardonnay
wine.review: Bogle has a solid reputation for its reliable, well-produced varietal wines at very affordable prices. This barrel-fermented Chardonnay offers appealing citrus and tropical fruit notes with a creamy texture. The wine's hint of residual sugar makes it an ideal match for savory/sweet fare, like a marinated pork loin with fruit coulis.

wine.name: R. Mondavi Chardonnay Napa
wine.review: One of the most popular California Chardonnays, this wine from Robert Mondavi is versatile and extremely easy to drink. A lush, buttery texture supports pure, up-front fruit flavors.

wine.name: Woodbridge Sauvignon Blanc
wine.review: This white wine gets a little extra substance from being aged on the lees. Nice acidity plays off tropical fruits and herbal aromas.

wine.name: Sterling Organic Sauvignon Blanc
wine.review: Organically farmed grapes that are free of any artificial fertilizers or synthetic chemicals. This wine has hints of lemon complemented by flavors of honeydew and lime zest.

wine.name: R. Mondavi Fumé Blanc Napa
wine.review: Most of the fruit for this white comes from the Stags Leap district, which is known and loved for its concentrated, varietally correct Sauvignon Blanc. The wine shows pronounced gooseberry and melon flavors, with well-balanced acidity.

wine.name: Sinskey Merlot, Carneros
wine.review: Full of exotic fennel-laced plum flavors and aromas of violets, this is a refreshing Merlot that really stands out from the rest.

wine.name: Ch. St. Jean Fumé Blanc, Sonoma
wine.review: This Fumé Blanc is bright and fresh. Showing notes of grapefruit, lemongrass, and jasmine, this wine will pair well with grilled chicken and seafood dishes.

wine.name: J Lohr Seven Oaks Cabernet Sauvignon, Paso Robles
wine.review: True to J Lohr's style, this wine has tons of oak and enough fruit to balance it nicely. Big and delicious, this wine needs to match with red meat to really shine.

wine.name: Ravenswood Zinfandel, Vintners Blend
wine.review: This is Ravenswood's introductory Zinfandel. A full-bodied red with black berry fruit, cherries, and pepper aromas. If you like this Zin, try the rest of their wines: you'll immediately see the family resemblance.

wine.name: Cakebread Chardonnay, Napa
wine.review: Jack Cakebread came to Napa for the first time 30 years ago to photograph, and subsequently fell in love with the region and the wine, and began making his wine. Granny Smith apple aromas and strong minerality and smokiness on the palate. Drink this now, or hold for 3-5 years for a delightful experience.

wine.name: Cline Zinfandel Ancient Vines
wine.review: This mouth-coating Zinfandel offers flavors of toasted caramel and dark berries. Soft tannins and a lasting vanilla finish make the Ancient Vine Zin dangerously easy to drink.

wine.name: Honeyrun Blackberry Honeywine Organic
wine.review: Honeyrun, a small family-run firm in the Sierra Nevada foothills, produces this blackberry honeywine from organically grown grapes. With ripe, jammy flavors, it is a sweet but not cloying dessert wine.

wine.name: Chalk Hill Cabernet Sauvignon, Sonoma
wine.review: Warm coffee and jam on the nose here, with blackcurrant on the palate and a structure that makes this wine a perfect candidate for the cellar. If you're going to drink this monster tonight, just make sure to air it out for a little while in a decanter first - then enjoy it with something meaty.

wine.name: Chalk Hill Sauvignon Blanc, Chalk Hill
wine.review: A rich, round and well-oaked style of Sauvignon Blanc. Aromas of tropical and stone fruits enhance the minerality that shines through from the soil on which it is grown.

wine.name: Rodney Strong Chardonnay
wine.review: A perfect example of Sonoma Chardonnay, full of bright peach fruit, crisp, lively and smooth. Hard to believe that one can still find good Sonoma Chard at this price!

wine.name: Teatown Cellars Merlot, Napa
wine.review: This Napa Merlot exhibits perfect ripeness. Black plums and spice surround a solid structure. Very pleasant and approachable right now. The grapes for this wine are purchased from top vineyards throughout Napa.

wine.name: Ridge Monte Bello
wine.review: This is the flagship wine of Ridge Winery, a winery which began in the late 1800's. The Montebello vineyard is located at an elevation between 1300 to 2600 feet creating a wine with layered complexity. The Montebello wine is a Bordeaux blend, made mostly of Cabernet Sauvignon, with intense, ripe flavors of black cherry, along with coffee bean and mocha.

wine.name: Sokol Blosser, Evolution No.9
wine.review: A complex yet easy-drinking blend of nine white grape varieties. Each brings its own style to the table, but they all end up working together to form a well-integrated and approachable whole.

wine.name: Simi Chardonnay Sonoma
wine.review: Simi is one of California's oldest wineries. Their Chardonnay is a rich wine with hints of vanilla on the nose backed up by loads of ripe fruit.

wine.name: Hogue Fumé Blanc Columbia Valley
wine.review: Crisp, herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc from the Pacific Northwest. Always delicious, always a value…a perennial best buy!

wine.name: Dr. Konstantin Frank Rkatsiteli
wine.review: Full of grassy, grapefruit-driven fruit with spicy notes, strawberries, and a bit of white pepper. Long and graceful, this finishes very well.

wine.name: Sterling Merlot Napa
wine.review: Aged in small oak barrels, this Merlot is the definition of an approachable red wine. The oak imparts subtle spicy vanilla notes on the nose, while plenty of dark fruit flavors keep the palate happy. This red goes with almost anything.

wine.name: Pellegrini East End Chardonnay
wine.review: This cool-climate New York Chardonnay has fresh pear and citrus notes. With 70% fermented in stainless steel tanks, it’s a crisp and lovely alternative to California Chardonnay.

wine.name: Coppola Merlot Blue Label Diamond Series
Pellegrini Merlot East End Select, North Fork
wine.review: This is a smooth, easy-drinking Merlot with inviting peppery and raspberry notes. The North Fork of Long Island is becoming famous for its accomplished expressions of Bordeaux grapes: taste this one and you'll be a doubter no more.

wine.name: Far Niente Chardonnay, Napa
wine.review: Classic-styled California Chardonnaty with spice and vanilla aromas of oak, then rich, intense flavors of melon and fig. It fills out and adds complexity with age - up to ten years.

wine.name: Far Niente Cabernet Sauvignon, Napa
wine.review: Coming from the Oakville area of Napa Valley, this dense powerhouse of a wine has a focused core of pure cassis fruit, with blackcurrant and black cherry flavors at the periphery. Lush tannins and balanced acidity make this a wine to drink today or cellar for 5-10 years.

wine.name: David Bruce Petite Sirah, Central Coast
wine.review: Not only does David Bruce produce stellar Pinot Noirs; he also makes a handful of other great reds in the Central Coast area of California. This Petite Sirah has just about everything you could want in a fruit-forward red wine. It's full of deep, dark berry flavors, rich body, and soft tannins.

wine.name: Estancia Merlot, Central Coast
wine.review: Big, dark, chocolatey fruit flavors characterize this wine from Estancia, one of California's most consistent wineries. This shows that unmistakable Merlot mouthfeel, followed by a long, oak-kissed finish.

wine.name: Big House Red, Santa Cruz
wine.review: A very popular red blend with loads of fruit and firm acidity. Consistently lovely, this is a great wine for parties: just about everyone loves it.

wine.name: Channing Daughters "Scuttlehole" Chardonnay
wine.review: This dry, fruit-driven Chardonnay really shows its cooler-climate roots. Pair this with all the classic matches like salmon, lobster and chicken and even fresh cheeses, vegetables and raw fish.

wine.name: Wolffer Chardonnay Reserve
wine.review: From the North Fork of Long Island comes this delightful Chardonnay. More Burgundian than New World in style, it shows clean and fresh floral notes. The winemakers have prevented malolactic fermentation, so the acidity is bright and enticing.

wine.name: Wolffer Merlot Reserve
wine.review: A classy Merlot from the Hamptons. Full-bodied with lush, soft tannins, this has excellent balance between its ripe fruit, structured acidity, and firm tannic backbone. Enjoy it with food.

wine.name: Lenz Merlot, North Fork
wine.review: Barrel fermented Merlot from 30 year old vineyards. Excellent dark fruit at the core. Dry and lightly spiced.

wine.name: Sonoma-Cutrer Chardonnay, "Les Pierres"
wine.review: Les Pierres Vineyard, once a rock quarry, is located at the southern end of the Sonoma Valley appellation, near Carneros. Cooling breezes and the volcanic soil that make up this vineyard create a chardonnay with addicting acidity and a lasting finish.

wine.name: Lenz Chardonnay "White Label", North Fork
wine.review: One of our favorite North Fork winemakers, Lenz's Eric Fry always bottles a crisp, flavorful Chardonnay under the "White Label." The mix of steel tank and oak fermentation keeps the wine lively while adding a touch of spice.

wine.name: Honig Cabernet Sauvignon
wine.review: Somehow Honig's well-made, organic Napa wines have managed to stay under the radar, but this Cabernet is certainly worth discovering: it has a deep, ruby-red color and a complex bouquet. On the palate, we got flavors of black cherry, cocoa, spice, and green tea. This is aged for 20 months in American oak barrels, only 30% of which are new. Well-balanced and well-structured.

wine.name: Groth Sauvignon Blanc, Napa
wine.review: Grown in a cooler microclimate of Napa Valley, this Sauvignon Blanc is crisp and refreshing with aromas of melon and citrus. A richness results from aging on its lees. Drink on its own or with many different types of fare.

wine.name: Blackstone Merlot, California
wine.review: A huge staff favorite. This wine is soft and packed with cherry flavors, with vanilla notes on the nose and a touch of chocolate on the palate. Pass on dessert: you can just have another glass.

wine.name: Ch. Montelena Chardonnay, Napa
wine.review: In the glass the wine is exactly what you would expect from a young Montelena Chardonnay, showing bright yellow gold, with good color density. It smells great, like a green apple pie, bright and a little citrus-y, a bowlful of fresh fruit. The palate is very nice, very smooth, with classic Chardonnay flavors of apple and kiwi, and a lovely finish that leaves the palate refreshed and wanting more.

wine.name: Sean Thackrey "Pleiades" XVII
wine.review: Sean Thackrey has made this wine for years now and he's never about to reveal the true blend in this red but rumor has it that it's based on Sangiovese. He always releases this wine as a non-vintage, instead labeling them with Roman numerals. Full of mint, meat, blackberry and ripe mocha-like tannins.

wine.name: Ch. Ste. Michelle Chardonnay, Columbia Valley
wine.review: Always a good value, this Washington St. Chardonnay has lots of buttery richness and intense fruit flavors. A nice match with full-flavored fish and poultry.

wine.name: Sterling Cabernet Sauvignon Napa
wine.review: A well-oaked, deeply hued red wine with structure and complexity that belie the Sterling's reasonable price tag. Fresh mixed berry flavors mingle with an earthy, woodsy character; drink this Cabernet Sauvignon with rich roasts or your favorite soft cheeses.

wine.name: Cape Indaba Sauvignon Blanc
wine.review: Another winner from South Africa's Cape Indaba. Their Sauvignon Blanc has loads of tropical fruit meshed with floral nuances.

wine.name: Cape Indaba Chenin Blanc
wine.review: One of Astor's best white wine values, this Chenin Blanc has tantalizing aromas of ripe pears and flowers, with exuberant tropical fruit on the palate. This is great with cheeses, fish, and light pasta dishes.

wine.name: Yalumba Antique Tawny
wine.review: A fortified wine with an average age of 15 years, Yaluma's Antique Tawny is produced from the finest barrels. Intense wood aging gives the bouquet flavors of mocha, caramel and dried figs.

wine.name: Sierra Cantabria Crianza Rioja
wine.review: Made from a blend of Tempranillo and Graciano in the Rioja region of Spain, this spends a touch of time in oak casks which adds spice to the red berried fruit.

wine.name: Mulderbosch Faithful Hound, Stellenbosch
wine.review: The Faithful Hound will always come through for you. This is a Bordeaux-style blend that sneaks in a few notes of licorice among the juicy red berry flavors. Full-bodied and rich, there’s a presence of spice as well, with medium tannins on the finish.

wine.name: Columbia Crest Grand Estate Cabernet Sauvignon
Alfasi Cabernet Sauvignon Kosher
wine.review: Mevushal.

wine.name: Alfasi Merlot Kosher
wine.review: A light-bodied mevushal red wine that is dry and full of plum flavors. Excellent before and during a meal.

wine.name: Alfasi Chardonnay Kosher
wine.review: Mevushal. Supple round notes of honey and brown butter make this Chilean bottling an excellent value.

wine.name: Flowers Pinot Noir
wine.review: The main things that stand out about the Flowers winery is the delicacy and acidity in their wines. This Pinot exhibits fresh red raspberries on the nose, while earth and red fruit fill the palate. Delicious!

wine.name: Flowers Chardonnay
wine.review: For this Sonoma Coast Chardonnay, Flowers winery has maintained long-term contracts with vineyards. Extremely Burgundian in style, this is cool-climate Chardonnay at its best. Flowers has produces a white that is well-balanced, with a slight creaminess, while notes of mushroom and citrus reveal themselves on the palate.

wine.name: Bartenura Asti Spumante, Kosher
wine.review: Mevushal.

wine.name: Côtes du Rhône, Centenaire, Kosher
wine.review: From the Rhône comes this easy-drinking mevushal red. The marked spiciness and fruit make this ideal with Moroccan food, and it doesn't have the high price of many other southern French wines.

wine.name: Coppola Claret, Diamond Series
wine.review: A chocolatey wine with a deep red color, dark plummy fruits, and a nice dose of warm baking spices on the finish. Silky-smooth tannins give it a great friendly structure.

wine.name: Benmarco Malbec
wine.review: Susana Balbo makes this supple and full-bodied red from 50-year-old vines. The age of the vines gives this wine uncommon richness and concentration, making it an extraordinarily sophisticated Malbec.

wine.name: Recanati Diamond Series Cabernet
wine.review: Cabernet Sauvignon of complexity and finesse, with fine tannins, fully ripe - which, by the way, is Kosher for Passover.

wine.name: Baron Herzog Chenin Blanc, Kosher
wine.review: Mevushal.

wine.name: Baron Herzog Zinfandel, Lodi Kosher
wine.review: Mevushal.

wine.name: Baron Herzog Sauvignon Blanc Shenandoah, Kosher
wine.review: This Sauvignon Blanc is grassy and floral, with citrus fruit character. It's dry, medium-bodied and goes well with fish or light meals. Drink lightly chilled. Mevushal.

wine.name: Baron Herzog Cabernet Sauvignon,Central Coast Kosher
wine.review: Mevushal.

wine.name: Baron Herzog Chardonnay,C. Coast Kosher
wine.review: Mevushal.

wine.name: Herzog Cabernet Special Reserve Kosher, Alexander Valley
Mulderbosch Sauvignon Blanc, Stellenbosch
wine.review: An absolutely beautiful, world-class Sauvignon Blanc. It's very crisp with layers of delicious ripe melon and mineral flavors. Serve with a simple fish dish and let this wine shine.

wine.name: Thelema Sauvignon Blanc
wine.review: A ripe, unwooded Sauvignon Blanc with intense gooseberry and all kinds of tropical flavors. This is a dry white wine with full-throttled fruit and a nice smooth texture.

wine.name: Vavasour Sauvignon Blanc, Awatere Valley
wine.review: This is Vavasour's entry level Sauvignon Blanc. It's dry yet rich and round on the palate with fresh grassy fruit and yellow fruit galore.

wine.name: Goats do Roam
wine.review: This red is medium-bodied with soft red fruit flavors and a pepperfy finish that could stand up to any charcuterie dish. Made in the style of a Côtes-du-Rhône but comes from South Africa.

wine.name: Norton Ridge Chardonnay, Napa
wine.review: A lightly oaked Chardonnay with plenty of bright citrus flavors and round honey notes. This definitely won't weigh you down during a long meal or a party; it is made to be refreshing and drinkable, with crisp acidity and a long finish.

wine.name: Columbia Riesling
wine.review: Accomplished, but still lots of fun – just like you. Everything that's lovely about this wine is completely typical of the best Rieslings: honey flavors, apricot aromas, and perfect balancing acidity that makes it perfect alone or with food (even spicy Indian dishes).

wine.name: Termes Numanthia
wine.review: Produced from super low yields and boasting powerful concentration, Numanthia will not let you down. This wine comes from 70-100 year old Tinta del Toro vines (the local name for Tempranillo) and exhibits flavors of bittersweet chocolate and earth. Drink now, or hold for decades to come.

wine.name: Coturri Estate Zinfandel
wine.review: Zinfandel has been a big success at Sonoma-based Coturri, a pioneer of commercial, organic wine production. This intense, earthy, and full-bodied Zin.

wine.name: Clos du Bois Cabernet Sauvignon
wine.review: Always reliable, this Sonoma Cab has gentle red fruit with a shade of oak. Very subtle and easy to like.

wine.name: Ch. St. Jean Chardonnay, Sonoma
wine.review: Think of a vanilla-scented crème brûlée, with fresh pear and pineapple slices on the side, and you're halfway to tasting this consistently delicious Sonoma County Chardonnay.

wine.name: Clos du Bois Chardonnay, North Coast
wine.review: Long, intense flavors dominate this barrel-fermented wine. Aromas of buttered toast and fall fruits make this a fine Chardonnay.

wine.name: Columbia Crest Chard Grand Estates
wine.review: Terrific fruit character in a straightforward Chardonnay. An easy-drinking white wine you'll want to keep around by the case.

wine.name: Franciscan Cabernet Sauvignon
wine.review: A classic example of Oakville Cabernet Sauvignon, rich and full-bodied with black cherry, plum, and currant flavors, along with sweet oak and supple tannins.

wine.name: Franciscan Chardonnay, Oakville
wine.review: Quintessential California Chardonnay. A touch of oak, great fruit, and a clean finish. This full-bodied wine hits the spot after another exhausting New York day!

wine.name: J Lohr Merlot, Paso Robles
wine.review: The aroma is dominated by blueberry and cherry fruit and layered with spicy, cedary oak on the finish. A medium-bodied Merlot that can be enjoyed alone or alongside any number of meat dishes.

wine.name: Ch. Montelena "Estate" Cabernet Sauvignon
wine.review: These are monumental wines from an historic winery. Chateau Montelena is the winery that won over the judges of the Paris Tasting in 1976. Their Cabernet Sauvignon is pure fruit goodness. Cassis, plum, and black cherry notes, with underlying thyme and coffee bean surround a structured core.

wine.name: Paumanok, Barrel Fermented Chardonnay
wine.review: A dry, oak-aged (90% new French) Chardonnay that's creamy in texture and full of pear and white, floral fruit.

wine.name: Diamond Creek Cabernet Sauvignon, Red Rock Terrace
Au Bon Climat Pinot Noir, Santa Barbara
wine.review: If you want exceptional California Pinot Noir for your money – look no further. This well-balanced Pinot has rich, red-raspberry fruit with smoky notes. This delicious wine is a natural choice with food. By hand-selecting the grapes from the best fruit Santa Barbara has to offer and through careful bottling, this winemaker does his job.

wine.name: Hahn Monterey Merlot
wine.review: An aromatic Merlot with spiced plum aromas and accessible tannins. The acidity is nicely balanced and adds brightness to this dry red wine.

wine.name: Rosenblum Zinfandel Cuvée XXXI
wine.review: With soft red fruit and nice tangy acidity, Rosenblum's Vintner's Cuvée is always a dependable performer. Enjoy this bright, spicy red with flavorful meats, cheeses, or pastas.

wine.name: Benziger Sauvignon Blanc
wine.review: A fresh, herbal, biodynamic white wine from California.

wine.name: Frog's Leap Cabernet Sauvignon, Napa
wine.review: This age worthy Cabernet Sauvignon shows dark fruits, coffee, dark chocolate and cream on the nose. On the palate, more of the same with minerals and tobacco to boot. This extracted Cabernet has chewy tannins and will be great after cellaring.

wine.name: Cakebread Merlot, Napa
wine.review: Rich aromas of blackberries, plums, black tea, and vanilla dominate the palate of this Napa Valley Merlot. The oak aging adds a spicy element on the finish.

wine.name: Qupé Syrah, Central Coast
wine.review: A tasty and aromatic Syrah from Qupé, a specialist in Rhône grapes. This medium-bodied wine boasts classic Syrah flavors: black fruit and a touch of black pepper.

wine.name: Bonterra Chardonnay Organic
wine.review: This Chardonnay comes from an estate committed to Certified Organic farming. Lightly oaked, round in texture, and a pleasure with something rich like a creamy pasta.

wine.name: La Crema Chardonnay, Sonoma Coast
wine.review: An elegant, stylish Chardonnay with understated fruit flavors of apples and melons, along with nuts and a bit of mineral. A wine of depth, complexity, and staying power.

wine.name: La Crema Pinot Noir, Sonoma Coast
wine.review: An oak aged Pinot Noir (25% new) that's full of pretty red berried fruit and a touch of spice. La Crema has been making wines in the cool vineyards of the Sonoma Coast since 1979.

wine.name: Markham Merlot Napa
wine.review: Ripe fruit and a weightless feel in the mouth set this Merlot apart. It's from a great Napa vintage and made in a friendly style that allows its red cherry flavors to shine brilliantly. A spectacular Merlot that will help you out in just about any red wine situation.

wine.name: Graacher Domprobst Riesling BA, Schaeffer
wine.review: Despite owning a mere six acres of vines, Willi Schaefer manages to produce the best Rieslings from the famous vineyards of Graach. This unctuous and decadent Riesling is made from individually picked grapes and packed with richness.

wine.name: Kendall-Jackson Sauv Blanc VR
wine.review: Tropical fruits with citrusy acidity characterize this party-friendly white wine. Though labeled a varietal Sauvignon Blanc, tiny amounts of more exotic grapes (under 5%, as required by law) are blended in to give it even more character.

wine.name: Coppola Rosso California
wine.review: An Italianate red from Francis Ford Coppola. Made from a delicious blend of fruity red grapes, this wine complements a broad range of simple dishes. Drink it with anything that calls for an honest, hearty red.

wine.name: Powers Cabernet Sauvignon, Washington
wine.review: A fantastic mid-weight Cabernet Sauvignon from Washington State that captures the combination of bright acidity, ripe currant-driven fruit, and mineral complexity that makes the best Northwestern reds so food-friendly. Try this with grilled lamb or veal.

wine.name: Sequoia Grove Cabernet Sauvignon
wine.review: Full bodied, rich and fruit forward with generous aromas of blackberry, currant, and spice. Fine tannins and a bright acidic structure.

wine.name: Ch. d'Yquem, Sauternes
wine.review: Still an infant this offers up intense notes of ripe orchard fruits. Peach, apricot, and plum are all rimmed with classic smoky notes from barrel ageing and the gentle spice of botrytis. In the mouth this is big yet airy with true mouthfilling weight but is a touch diffuse on the midpalate and finishes a bit short. This needs time to integrate and will remain a truly hedonistic vintage.

wine.name: Ch. La Gomerie, St.-Émilion
wine.review: Here is a modern styled Bordeaux made from 100% old-vine Merlot. The wine is deep and voluptuous in color, aroma, and texture but maintains great tannic structure. The nose gives lots of chocolate, licorice, and spicy oak. Look for it to age for several more years, also to drink well now.

wine.name: Ch. Clos Dubreuil, St.-Émilion
wine.review: This is pure creme de cassis on the palate with blueberries, wildflowers, smoke and toast on the finish. A full-bodied, richly-textured red wine that will hold for a good decade but is drinking wonderfully already.

wine.name: Ch. Bellevue, St.-Émilion
wine.review: This is a classic right bank Bordeaux with a high proportion of Merlot (60-70%) grown on clay and limestone soil. The Lacaz family have been making wine on their six-hectare estate for three generations. The wine ages for two years in cask before release to give it superior age-ability though, with its preponderance of Merlot, it is approachable in its youth.

wine.name: Westerly Sauvignon Blanc, Santa Ynez Valley
wine.review: Westerly Vineyards sustainably farms 85 acres of low-yielding grapevines on a 200-acre ranch located in Happy Canyon. This Sauvignon Blanc shows beautiful concentration with notes of honeysuckle, sweet-and-sour citrus, and grass notes.

wine.name: Hogue Late Harvest White Riesling Columbia Valley
wine.review: From the Pacific Northwest, this golden late-harvest Riesling has a slightly sweet, rich, spicy style, offset by just the right amount of acidity. Enjoy as an apéritif or with light desserts.

wine.name: Tres Picos Borsao
wine.review: Old-vine Garnacha shows brilliantly in this Tres Picos bottling. Red berries and cherries dance on the palate while earthy notes and balanced acidity keep things lively through the finish.

wine.name: Notios White, Gaia
wine.review: Notios, which means "the southerner”, comes to us from the southern portion of the Greek mainland in the Peloponnese. This is a blend of Moschofilero and Rodititis, creating a wine with a bright citrus body and a lean, long finish. Perfect with seafood.

wine.name: Morellino di Scansano, Moris Farms
wine.review: Decades ago, Moris Farms fought hard for their own appellation of Morellino di Scansano. Years later, their commitment to their vines still shines through in every bottle they make. This hearty red is full of dark, round, earthy berries, with a soothing, velvety texture and approachable acidity.

wine.name: Liberty School Cabernet Sauvignon
wine.review: Pure, straightforward Cabernet character: flavors of dark berries, cassis, and milk chocolate. This is well-balanced in the mouth and carries itself with considerable elegance. A firm structure makes it perfect with grilled meats.

wine.name: Bogle Merlot
wine.review: Bogle’s Merlot is another great example of the soft and silky wine that this varietal can be. Concentrated aromas of earthy spice and cherries surround the senses. Mere hints of pipe tobacco and spicy oak lend depth to the finish, reinforced by firm, tannins.
